summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to various recipients, primarily alleging widespread corruption, obstruction, and criminal facilitation by the SEC and other government agencies. Dilorio details specific claims related to financial fraud involving Knight Capital/Virtu Financial (NITE), Blackstone, Eastman Kodak (KODK), and various 'money laundering shell' companies. He accuses SEC officials of protecting certain individuals and entities while denying his whistleblower award claims.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption, obstruction of his whistleblower claims, and facilitation of financial fraud involving Knight Capital, Blackstone, and others.

persons.name: Anthony Zakel
persons.context: Named as the first Inspector General of the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC), hired to oversee agency programs.

persons.name: Boehler
persons.context: Referenced as a Kushner roommate who was to be investigated by the DFC IG regarding a $765 million loan to Kodak.

persons.name: Jason New
persons.context: Identified as a Blackstone representative on the Kodak board, involved in the internal investigation of the Kodak loan deal.

persons.name: Steve Schwarzman
persons.context: Described as a key figure in the Knight Capital 'glitch' bailout, connected to Trump and Epstein, and high on the SEC's 'do not investigate list.'

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: Accused of corruption, non-disclosure of conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell and Jared Fishman, and facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Former colleague of Jay Clayton accused of playing a key role in fraud related to Knight Capital/NITE.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: Frequent recipient of Dilorio's emails, accused of not distributing his whistleblower information within the SEC.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: Referenced as the 'grossly corrupt SEC IG' whose investigations are alleged to be cover-ups.

persons.name: Lara Shalov Mehraban
persons.context: Accused of having a conflict due to a former colleague/boss relationship with Virtu Financial's Doug Cifu and obstructing investigations.

persons.name: Doug Cifu
persons.context: Former Paul Weiss colleague of Lara Mehraban, accused of running the 'criminal entity' NITE (Knight/Virtu).

persons.name: Alex Ioffe
persons.context: Former CFO of Interactive Brokers, hired by Cifu, implicated in the context of SAR filing failures.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Board member of NITE/Virtu, Trump campaign manager
persons.context: Sits on the board of NITE/Virtu and FSD Pharma, linked to Trump and alleged money laundering schemes.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.context: Described as a 'prolific Bag Man' involved with money laundering shells like SkyWay and Blink Charging (BLNK).

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Trump fundraiser and business partner of Jeffrey Epstein, linked to the BLNK fraud.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Bag man involved in fraudulent note assignments related to companies like NewLead, FreeSeas.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Bag man barred by FINRA, involved in money laundering shells and linked to Blink Charging.

persons.name: Dick Best
persons.context: Former FINRA official promoted to SECNY, accused of potentially obstructing investigations related to his BBH AML complaint.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his Zorro Ranch, mentioned in connection with Blink Charging.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Steve Schwarzman, Jonathan Farkas, and Bill Richardson.

connections.description: Dilorio repeatedly sends allegations and appeals to SEC official Janey, accusing Janey of not distributing his information and being part of the obstruction.
Schwarzman is implied to be protected by Clayton's SEC due to being on a 'do not investigate list' and political connections.
Former colleagues at Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman is accused of playing a key role in fraud Clayton allegedly facilitates.
Former colleagues at Paul Weiss; Mehraban is accused of obstructing investigations into Cifu's company, Virtu Financial (NITE).
Cifu hired Ioffe as CFO of Virtu Financial; both implicated in the context of compliance failures.
Described as 'connected' in the text, indicating a social or financial association.
New is a Blackstone executive, Schwarzman is co-founder of Blackstone.
Both are Bag Men involved in alleged frauds; implied to be related.
Both are described as 'Bag Men' involved in similar money laundering shell schemes.

events.title: Anthony Zakel hired as DFC IG
events.description: Anthony Zakel is named the first Inspector General of the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC).

events.title: DFC IG announces review of Kodak loan
events.description: The DFC Inspector General announces a review of the proposed $765 million loan to Eastman Kodak.

events.title: Kodak signs Letter of Intent with Phlow
events.description: Eastman Kodak signs a Letter of Intent with Phlow Corporation to show it had a customer for its future APIs, as part of its DFC loan application.

events.title: Knight Capital 'glitch' and bailout
events.description: A trading glitch causes Knight Capital's stock to collapse, leading to a bailout by a consortium including Blackstone, Goldman Sachs, and Jefferies.

events.title: Virtu Financial (NITE) reports Q2 2020 earnings
events.description: Virtu Financial reports Q2 2020 earnings, showing a receivable of $2.44 billion, which Dilorio alleges is fraudulent accounting for naked short fails.

events.title: Blink Charging (BLNK) PR pump
events.description: Blink Charging issues a press release about a grant for charging stations, causing the stock to rise 27% on high volume. Dilorio alleges this was a fraudulent pump-and-dump with no corresponding 8-K filing.

events.title: Dilorio's formal appeal denial
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends a formal appeal regarding the preliminary denial of his Opco whistleblower award application, summarizing years of allegations.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges a massive, ongoing conspiracy involving the SEC, Blackstone, and others to facilitate financial fraud and obstruct investigations.
Dilorio claims the core business of Knight Capital/Virtu Financial (NITE) is 'abusive naked shorting' of OTC market shells to facilitate money laundering, and that the SEC actively enables this.

A key allegation involves a $765 million DFC loan to Eastman Kodak (KODK), which Dilorio claims was a fraudulent 'pump and dump' grift involving Blackstone's Jason New and connected to Trump/Kushner interests.
Dilorio accuses SEC Chairman Jay Clayton and his former Sullivan & Cromwell colleague Jared Fishman of deep conflicts of interest and facilitating fraud related to NITE.
The document references connections between several alleged fraud participants (e.g., Schwarzman, Farkas) and Jeffrey Epstein.
